column1: Would you like me to drive for a while?

Don't worry about me—you just get some sleep.
We've still got a long way to go.

You kids don't need to be worrying over an
adult like that. This is nothing for me.

To be fair, you are an excellent driver. The RV
tends to shake a lot more when I'm behind
the wheel.

I may not look it, but I used to patrol in a squad
car. Driving's second nature to me at this point.

Yep, every day. Back when I manned the police
boxes.
Eh, it was just part of the job.
Sure, once you've got a license.
How tough is it? Being police?

Oh, right—you're studying to become some
police bigwig, aren't you, Niijima?
Yes, but I've only just begun.

Wouldn't really recommend it myself—this job's
nothin' but hell.

Your hours are a mess, you get transferred all
over the place... Anything goes down at the
scene, you get blamed.

That may be so, but my heart's set on it.
No matter how tough it may be...

Well, if your heart's set, then do what you
gotta do.
But, as your future senior, I'll share this:

The harder you work, the more you wind up
putting the people in your life on the back
burner.

Criminals don't care about your schedule.
Tragedies don't care. You'll barely see your
own home.

Sit on that for a bit, then decide if the force
is right for you.
Well, I am already quite aware.

And speaking of, don't you have any family
waiting for you at home?
Aw, can it... Just mind your own business.

Let's just say, you've gotta think about yourself
before you can worry about anyone else.
You just reminded me of my father, is all.

He was an officer too. Unfortunately, he lost
his life on duty.

He took his job a lot more seriously than you
seem to, but when you boil it down, you two
are actually quite similar.

Heh, you shouldn't diss your father so badly,
comparing him to me...

When you were little, your old man probably
wasn't home often either, was he? How'd you
feel about that?

My father was an officer who acted on his
beliefs... all the way to the end.

He taught me that his duty was to keep people
from being hurt.

It may just be his influence on me, but I think
becoming an officer is still an admirable path
in life.
If only that were always true.

Our ability to help is restrained. The shrewder
and more malicious the target, the less we can
actually serve them justice.

Held back by superiors, held back by the red
tape, held back by all sorts of laws...

The only thing the police do is obey
orders—even when they involve total
injustice or an absence of human logic.

Basically, the cops I see every day are nothing
but a bunch of spineless dogs—and that
includes when I'm lookin' in the mirror.
They sure put me through hell.
So you're a dog too, Zenkichi?

I've heard about it. I'm impressed you never
cracked under it all.
I'm a lot more loyal to my master than I look.
But anyway, that wasn't what I was getting at.

I meant when you were still just a kid—
how did you feel about your dad rarely
being home, Niijima?

I did understand that it was part of his job, but...
I do remember missing him, still.
But at least I always had my sister with me.

Sorry to bother you with all that. You guys had
better get to sleep already.

If we run into trouble while you're all too tired,
I'm the one who'll be in real deep shit.
